title: TSX opens lower as energy stocks fall, Shopify pulls down technology sector
text:
TSX opens lower as energy stocks fall, Shopify pulls down technology sector

Stock Markets 19 minutes ago (Oct 29, 2019 09:46)

© Reuters. FILE PHOTO: A Toronto Stock Exchange sign adorns a doorway at the Exchange Tower building in Toronto (Reuters) - Canada's main stock index fell at the open on Tuesday, as lower crude prices hit the energy sector, and e-commerce platform Shopify Inc's shares tumbled on weak quarterly results, dragging the technology sector. At 9:30 a.m. ET (1330 GMT), the Toronto Stock Exchange's S&P/TSX Composite index was down 57.1 points, or 0.35%, at 16,330.43. The energy sector fell 1.2%, while the technology sector shed 1.5%.
